post.body: Appreciated. I'll fire that up on the weekend. Glad to see there are other Ubuntu users out there.
No riding though a lot of walking. Leaving tomorrow for Manhattan!
"In Europe", by Geert Mak.
OK - debaters must be identified ex ante otherwise thing becomes a blog. Full transcript available somewhere. Audience voting.
Not sure.
Given mobile phone rates in Canada, there are no windows because the inhabitants die if they are exposed to sunlight.
Like this a lot. How do you moderate something on Twitter?
My bad. I thought they had wised up. But RIAA has ben opposing progress since before the player piano so I shouldn't be surprised.
Why did I RT Guy Kawasaki? Everybody follows him.
RT @guykawasaki: Periodic Table of Awesome: http://ow.ly/1bK
Canada's Do Not Call List registration link. Make telemarketers go away! http://bit.ly/dsVR
Ubuntu question - anyone have good luck using bittorrent on Ubuntu?
Props to BA's Open Skies subsidiary for the best transAtlantic flight ever. Same to US CBP who were civil and human. OK, props was inapt.
New York City is an antidote to tiredness and indifference. Not that I'm indifferent. #NYC
Avoid Orly airport unless you like being ignored by your airline and abused by "security". #france #paris
At least one Paris Metro pickpocket has a sore hand tonight.
Musee du Luxembourg is def worth a visit. #paris
Getting lost in Paris is not as bad as it sounds.
I have won the lottery of travel - in an open four seater to Paris!
Leaving London for Paris. St Pancras and Eurostart are wonderful. EOP Tour Day 2 is off to an excellent start.
Apple store on Regent St. London has a good vibe. And they're selling lots of product.
A view from China on 2008. Not what you'll hear on CNN or CBC. http://bit.ly/WxxC
Power on at home. New world of Twitter apps to explore! http://tinyurl.com/2ul26n
Lack of power at home makes it hard to Tweet. Hydro says 4 more hours. :(
Merry Christmas to all Tweeple...hope you're having a great day.
dm mhallfindlay Sorry I missed you - happy to talk over the holidays and I'd be glad to call you at your convenience. I'm D.McGow's friend.
NSFW but funny. http://tinyurl.com/5ufjsm
Amazed and politics in Canada and the rudeness of some "public servants". Point: don't fly unless you like being abused by customs morons.
RT @shawnmicallef: #senate Pamela Wallin is a Con? And Mike Duffy represents me as a canadian now? Dark dark Canadian days.
RT @pkedrosky: @timoreilly i refuse to read tapscott's books on principle: they are all IQ-reducing.
RT @rhh: Frankly it scares the crap out of me that journalists can be so reliable to a political party that they're appointed to the Senate
Nobelist Paul Krugman lays out Wall Street in one punch. http://bit.ly/IhRP
RT @MarkThoma: del.ico.us: Bushâ€™s Philosophy Stoked the Mortgage Bonfire - NYTimes.com http://tinyurl.com/7l8eqk
Important ruling on Canadian corporate governance. http://bit.ly/Nf6v
RT @remarkk: RT @rahafharfoush: Let's have a "We're right behind you America" inauguration party to launch #changegovca and #changecamp!!
RIAA drops lawsuits. In other news, average IQ at RIAA climbs to triple digits. http://bit.ly/stTN
On my way to downtown Manhattan to get a Mino HD...that i can't get in Canada.
No snow in NYC...yet. #snowmageddon
